intro: Moniera procumbens f. flavida, commonly known as the yellow-flowered moniera, is a flowering plant characterized by its prostrate growth habit and distinctive yellow flowers. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant features small, ovate leaves with a hairy surface and produces umbels of yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and herbal collections.
